hexagrams.judgment: The Creative works sublime success, furthering through perseverance.
hexagrams.image: The movement of heaven is full of power. Thus the superior man makes himself strong and untiring.

lines.line_2: Dragon appearing in the field. It furthers one to see the great man.
lines.line_3: All day long the superior man is creatively active.
lines.line_6: Arrogant dragon will have cause to repent.

hexagrams.judgment: The Receptive brings about sublime success, furthering through the perseverance of a mare.
hexagrams.image: The earth's condition is receptive devotion. Thus the superior man who has breadth of character carries the outer world.

lines.line_1: When there is hoarfrost underfoot, solid ice is not far off.
lines.line_2: Straight, square, and great. Without purpose, yet nothing remains unfurthered.
lines.line_3: Hidden lines. One is able to remain persevering.
lines.line_4: A tied-up sack. No blame, no praise.
lines.line_5: A yellow lower garment brings supreme good fortune.
lines.line_6: Dragons fight in the meadow. Their blood is black and yellow.

hexagrams.judgment: Difficulty at the beginning works supreme success, furthering through perseverance. Nothing should be undertaken.
hexagrams.image: Clouds and thunder: the image of Difficulty at the Beginning. Thus the superior man brings order out of confusion.

lines.line_1: Hesitation and hindrance. It furthers one to remain persevering.
lines.line_2: Difficulties pile up. Horse and wagon part. He is not a robber; he will woo at the right time.
lines.line_3: Who overcomes by force must meet with repentance. Misfortune.
lines.line_4: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears.
lines.line_5: A tree is born from a single seedling. Undertakings bring reward.

hexagrams.judgment: Youthful Folly has success. It is not I who seek the young fool; the young fool seeks me. At the first oracle, I inform him. If he asks two or three times, it is importunity. If he importunes, I give him no information.
hexagrams.image: A spring wells up at the foot of the mountain: the image of Youth. Thus the superior man fosters his character by thoroughness in all that he does.

lines.line_1: To make a fool develop it furthers one to apply discipline. The fetters should be removed.
lines.line_2: To bear with fools in kindliness brings good fortune. To know how to take women brings good fortune. The son is capable of taking charge of the household.
lines.line_3: Take not a maiden who, when she sees a man of bronze, loses possession of herself. Nothing furthers.
lines.line_6: In punishing folly, it does not further one to commit transgressions.

hexagrams.affirmation: I grow and learn from folly.

hexagrams.judgment: Waiting. If you are sincere, you have light and success. Perseverance brings good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.
hexagrams.image: Clouds rise up to heaven: the image of Waiting. Thus the superior man eats and drinks, is joyous and of good cheer.

lines.line_1: Waiting in the meadow. It furthers one to abide in what endures. No blame.
lines.line_2: Waiting on the sand. There is some gossip. The end brings good fortune.
lines.line_3: Waiting in the mud brings about the arrival of the enemy.
lines.line_4: Waiting in blood. Get out of the pit.
lines.line_5: Waiting with food and drink. Perseverance brings good fortune.
lines.line_6: One falls into the pit. Three uninvited guests arrive. Honor them, and in the end, there will be good fortune.
